title: Gwyneth Paltrow reveals she waited to live with Brad Falchuk to give their teenage children 'space'
text:
Gwyneth Paltrow and husband Brad Falchuk waited a year into their marriage until they moved in together.

The actress, 47, explained her reasons behind the decision to live apart from Brad, 48, was to give their teenage children 'space' as she appeared on Jimmy Kimmel on Wednesday.

Marking their one-year wedding anniversary, Gwyneth joked: 'We made it, we made it.'

Taking time: Gwyneth Paltrow and husband Brad Falchuk waited a year into their marriage until they moved in together on Jimmy Kimmel on Wednesday

Asking why it took so long for them to move in together, Jimmy, 51, said: 'Now why is it? Usually it goes the other way.'

'Well, true. I think really because we have, we each have two teenage children whom we love very much, but we were just trying to be mindful and give them a little space and not move too quickly,' Gwyneth said.

She added: 'Now we're merged and it's great. He got to keep some of his stuff, he's got good taste. He's got really nice clothes and put some nice chairs in the house.'

Doting mum: The actress, 47, explained her reasons behind the decision to live apart from Brad, 48, was to give their teenage children 'space'

Celebrations: Marking their one-year wedding anniversary, Gwyneth joked: 'We made it, we made it.'

Married: In 2014, Paltrow began dating producer Brad Falchuk, whom she met on the set of Glee in 2010. They married in September last year (pictured last month)

The Oscar-winning actress has daughter Apple, 15, and son Moses, 13, with ex-husband Chris Martin, 42. Brad has daughter Isabella and son Brody with his first wife Suzanne Falchuk.

In 2014, Paltrow began dating producer Brad Falchuk, whom she met on the set of Glee in 2010.

The couple went public with their relationship in April 2015 and announced their engagement in January last year. The marriage ceremony was held in September 2018 in The Hamptons on Long Island, New York.

Thoughtful: The Oscar-winning actress has daughter Apple, 15, and son Moses, 13, with ex-husband Chris Martin, 42 (pictured May 2017)

Falchuk had been married since 1994 to Suzanne Bukinik Falchuk, who filed for divorce in 2013.

Gwyneth, who looked incredible in a black Staud dress with white piping, was promoting her new series The Politician that premiered last week on Netflix.

She revealed that Brad and his writing partner Ian Brennan, 41, wrote a leading part for her.

New series: Gwyneth was promoting her new series The Politician that premiered last week on Netflix

'He was writing it and ...first it started I was inspiring the part. Then he said, ''You have to be in this'',' Gwyneth said.

Gwyneth said she's focused on her day job with Goop and 'it's hard to sort of sneak away and do acting parts'.

'But, I did, you know I love him a lot, and he wanted me to do it and so he roped me back in,' Gwyneth said.

'It was really fun. I enjoyed it a lot,' she added.

Gwyneth stuck around after her interview and cooked pasta with chef Evan Funke and Jimmy.
description: The 47-year-old actress during a talk show visit Wednesday revealed why she waited to live with husband Brad Falchuk after being married for nearly a year.
